The claim was based on an article publis: which reported the discovery of a "mysterious 4-meter long sea monster" that washed ashore in Mexico in June 2016.
The photograph of the sea creature found: Mexico, resembled the "Montauk Monster" from 2008, including distinctive facial features and creases in the flesh.
Another image associated with the claim: initially thought to be an unidentified animal carcass but later identified as the decomposed head of a sperm whale. This highlights the tendency of tabloids to sensationalize and fail to follow up on explanations for such discoveries.
